data.name: tTopTitle
data.value: You Are Adding/Requesting a New User to the Portal

data.name: s2SubTitle
data.value: Enter the Person Name and Contact Information

data.name: s3SubTitle
data.value: Select Groups and Roles For User

data.name: s4SubTitle
data.value: Send Invitation/Request and Instructions to New User

data.name: s5SubTitle
data.value: Your Account Invitation or Request has been sent.

data.name: s1TopText
data.value: What Type of account do you want this user to have?

data.name: tOnlyPending
data.value: You can add only Pending User

data.name: s1Comments
data.value: Select ‘Portal Account’ if you want this user to communicate, share, coordinate, and actively contribute to your projects. Select ‘External/E-mail’ if you want this user to be able to have the portal send notifications or receive feedback through e-mail.

data.name: s1TopDiv
data.value: Portal supports 2 types of user access paradigms. The first is a standard Portal Account which gives the user working access to the portal. The second type of user is called an external user and it allows e-mail access only for users. This wizard will help you easily set up a new user on the portal.

data.name: s2TopDiv
data.value: This information is used to establish the basic profile of the user in the system.

data.name: s3TopDiv
data.value: Portal supports 2 types of group structures, one for structuring teams, and one for communicating. A User can be in multiple business groups (teams), but only in a single communication group (directory).

data.name: tTextForRegularAccount
data.value: Your user is almost ready to be notified. If you wish, you can add some special welcome comments below and then click the ‘Create’ button to finalize the invitation.

data.name: tTextForPendingAccount
data.value: Your user is almost ready to be notified. If you wish, you can add some special welcome comments below and then click the ‘Create’ button to finalize the invitation.

data.name: tTextForExternalAccount
data.value: Your user is almost ready to be notified. If you wish, you can add some special welcome comments below and then click the ‘Create’ button to finalize the invitation.

data.name: tTextForExternal
data.value: You are adding user to the External Group. Go to the next step page!

data.name: tTextForWelcome
data.value: Type Welcome Comments And Create New User Account!

data.name: s5TopText
data.value: You will now be placed into the main user management screen.

data.name: s5TextHeader
data.value: What Else Can You Do with New User?

data.name: s1CommentsPM
data.value: Select ‘Portal Account’ if you want this user to communicate, share, coordinate, and actively contribute to your projects. Select ‘External/E-mail’ if you want this user to be able to have the portal send notifications or receive feedback through e-mail.

data.name: s1CommentsGU
data.value: You can only invite new user to the system.

data.name: tTextForPartnerAccount
data.value: Your user is almost ready to be notified. If you wish, you can add some special welcome comments below and then click the ‘Create’ button to finalize the invitation.

data.name: EmailDuplicate
data.value: User with the mentioned e-mail already exists!

data.name: s3TopDivConvert
data.value: Check users for adding to portal

data.name: s4TopDivConvert
data.value: You will have to actualize user information

data.name: s5TopDivConvert
data.value: Select secure groups and roles for new users

data.name: ConnectError
data.value: Connect Error or Invalid User Name & Password!

data.name: CompareFields
data.value: You can assign another Source Fields to Portal Fields.

data.name: GroupSelectError
data.value: You must select Group or Role!

data.name: tWereErrors
data.value: There are some errors occured during creation process.

data.name: s0ConvertComments
data.value: You can import users from Domain LDAP Directory or from file
